ghost

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GhostBlinky, GhostClyde, GhostController, GhostInky, GhostPinky, Pacman, Tile

extends java.lang.Object

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        This method will return whether an object is dead or not.
        Returns:
        dead

      • kill

        public void kill()
        This method will kill the ghosts for the rest of the round if the ghosts collide with Pacman while in frightended mode; this method is used in the Pacman class, checkDirection() method.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This method is used by most subclasses which inherits from the GameObject class; this method draws objects onto the canvas.

      • finished

        public static boolean finished(App app,
                               Pacman waka)
        This method checks whether the game is finished. The game can only be finished if the Pacman is able to obtain all fruits or is killed by colliding with any of the ghosts. This method works in conjunction with App.reset().
        Parameters:
        app - the App.
        waka - a Pacman object.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • drawEnding

        public static void drawEnding(App app)
        This method will draw either a win or loss message. Using System.currentTimeMillis(), we ensure that the message is shown for 10 seconds before resetting to the original state of the game.
        Parameters:
        app - the App.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        This method is used in the main App class to reset GameObject states (specifically concerned with the Ghosts) back to its original state.

      • checkDirection

        public void checkDirection()
        This method is the controller of the movement for the ghost. It will help the ghost make decisions when approaching a wall as well as make decisions when targeting Pacman. It works with multiple other methods: setTargetNode() and chooseShortestDecision(). Additional getters and setters from other classes were used to obtain needed information, such as a Tile's neighbours, for example.

      • runAway

        public void runAway()
        This method is used by the ghosts ONLY. They run away from from Pacman, choosing random directions to go in (without going backwards (except for the initial turn backwards)) everytime they are located at an intersersection. This method works with chooseRandomDirection().

      • chooseRandomDirection

        public void chooseRandomDirection()
        This method is only used at intersections and will cause the ghost to pick a direction at random WITHOUT going backwards.

      • setGhostFrightIndex

        public void setGhostFrightIndex()
        This method works similarly to how Pacman's open-close mouth animation works. We will only increase the index by a small amount (in floats) and add it to an int, which will floor the number to give us an index.

      • drawGhost

        public void drawGhost()
        This method is used by the ghosts ONLY. Found in the GhostController class, draw() method, it will draw the Ghosts depending on one of its many states.

      • chooseShortestDecision

        public void chooseShortestDecision()
        Method that will be overrided by the Ghost classes.

      • setTargetNode

        public void setTargetNode()
        Method that will be overrided by the Ghost classes.

      • drawTarget

        public void drawTarget()
        Method that will be overrided by the Ghost classes.

      • move

        public void move()
        Method that will be overrided by the Ghost classes.
